titleStmt.title: J. M. Crawford et al. to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG6196

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
Whereas a Judgment has been rendered by the Montgomery Ct. Court at its Feb. Term 1865 for $500. against Wm S Wills and Robt Hedger as Sureties, for Forfeited Recognizance of Geo Hedger: and whereas said Robt Hedger is insolvent and said wills will have the whole of said $500. to pay: and whereas said Wm S. Wills is a poor man and has been robbed by Guerillas and compelled to leave this County by reason thereof: now we, the undersigned, respectfully petition Your Excellency Gov T. E. Bramlette to remit so much of said Judgment against said Sureties as the Law will permit.
February 1865.
Members of the Bar and Officers of the Court.

J. M. Crawford clk. &c
Thos Metcalfe
Richard Reid
J D Reid
Jas H Trimble D S
Jno W Hazelrigg
Thos Turner
P C Bedford Sheriff M C
Wm H Holt
J P Pro tem J. M. Co

Comwth of Ky
vs } Petition
Wm S Wills &c
Holt
